title: Deccan Plateau
summary: The Deccan Plateau is the large plateau in southern India between the Western Ghats and the Eastern Ghats, and loosely defined as the peninsular region between these ranges that is south of the Narmada river. A rocky terrain marked by boulders, it ranges between 100 metres (330 ft) and 1,000 metres (3,300 ft), with an average elevation of about 600 metres (2,000 ft).[1]
